what: Introduction Step 1: Creating the Seurat object
title: Introduction to rmams
text: Matrix Analysis Metadata Standards (MAMS) can used capture relevant information data matrices annotations produced common complex analysis workflows single-cell data. use case demonstrates MAMS can used annotate matrices annotations produced analysis multi-modal single-cell data containing RNA Antibody Derived Tags (ADTs). analyze PBMC 1K dataset Seurat package according Multi-modal Weighted Nearst Neighbor vignettes. analytical steps include: Importing raw/droplet filtered/cell matrices Performing quality control subsetting filtered matrix include high-quality cells Clustering cells RNA Clustering cells ADTs Clustering cells RNA ADT Clustering T-cells RNA Clustering T-cells ADT Clustering T-cells RNA ADT workflow demonstrates different subsets cells/observations produced due QC/filtering can made based different biological subsets. also produces several matrices annotations different modalities. Note goal workflow less producing best clustering results cell type characterization. Rather focused producing data/results commonly generated real-world analyses can annotated MAMS. information MAMS, see GitHub repository

previous_headings: Introduction Step 1: Creating the Seurat object
title: Introduction to rmams
code: library(dplyr) library(Seurat) library(patchwork) raw.matrices <- Read10X(data.dir = "../data/raw_feature_bc_matrix/") #> 10X data contains more than one type and is being returned as a list containing matrices of each type. data.raw <- CreateSeuratObject(counts = raw.matrices[[1]], assay = "RNA", project = "pbmc1k") adt <- CreateAssayObject(counts = raw.matrices[[2]]) data.raw[["ADT"]] <- adt  nonempty.matrices <- Read10X(data.dir = "../data/filtered_feature_bc_matrix") #> 10X data contains more than one type and is being returned as a list containing matrices of each type. data.nonempty <- CreateSeuratObject(counts = nonempty.matrices[[1]], assay = "RNA", project = "pbmc1k") adt <- CreateAssayObject(counts = nonempty.matrices[[2]]) data.nonempty[["ADT"]] <- adt

previous_headings: Introduction Step 1: Creating the Seurat object
title: Introduction to rmams
text: filtered matrix subsetted based mitochondrial percentage total number features detected:
code: data.nonempty[["percent.mt"]] <- PercentageFeatureSet(data.nonempty, pattern = "^MT-") data <- subset(data.nonempty, subset = nFeature_RNA > 200 & percent.mt < 5)

previous_headings: Introduction Step 1: Creating the Seurat object
title: Introduction to rmams
text: goal many single cell workflows perform clustering identify biologically distrinct groups cells. perform clustering QC’ed cells using RNA, ADT, also re-cluster T-cells .

previous_headings: Introduction Step 1: Creating the Seurat object > Analyzing all cells
what: RNA only clustering of all cells
title: Introduction to rmams
code: DefaultAssay(data) <- 'RNA' data <- NormalizeData(data) %>% FindVariableFeatures() %>% ScaleData() %>% RunPCA() data <- FindNeighbors(data, dims = 1:10) data <- FindClusters(data, resolution = 2, verbose = FALSE) data <- RunUMAP(data, reduction = 'pca', dims = 1:10, assay = 'RNA',                reduction.name = 'rna.umap', reduction.key = 'rnaUMAP_') DimPlot(data, reduction = 'rna.umap')

previous_headings: Introduction Step 1: Creating the Seurat object > Analyzing all cells
what: ADT only clustering of all cells
title: Introduction to rmams
code: DefaultAssay(data) <- 'ADT' VariableFeatures(data) <- rownames(data[["ADT"]]) data <- NormalizeData(data, normalization.method = 'CLR', margin = 2) %>%    ScaleData() %>% RunPCA(reduction.name = 'apca', dims = 1:10) data <- FindNeighbors(data, reduction = "apca", dims = 1:10) data <- FindClusters(data, graph.name = "ADT_snn", resolution = 2, verbose = FALSE) data <- RunUMAP(data, reduction = 'apca', dims = 1:10,                reduction.name = 'adt.umap', reduction.key = 'adtUMAP_') DimPlot(data, reduction = 'adt.umap')

previous_headings: Introduction Step 1: Creating the Seurat object > Analyzing all cells
title: Introduction to rmams
code: data <- FindMultiModalNeighbors(   data, reduction.list = list("pca", "apca"),    dims.list = list(1:20, 1:10), modality.weight.name = "RNA.weight" ) data <- RunUMAP(data, nn.name = "weighted.nn", reduction.name = "wnn.umap", reduction.key = "wnnUMAP_") data <- FindClusters(data, graph.name = "wsnn", algorithm = 3, resolution = 2, verbose = FALSE) DimPlot(data, reduction = 'wnn.umap', label = TRUE, repel = TRUE) FeaturePlot(data, features = c("adt_CD3","rna_CD3E"), reduction = 'wnn.umap')

previous_headings: Introduction Step 1: Creating the Seurat object
title: Introduction to rmams
code: data.tcell <- subset(data, seurat_clusters %in% 0:7)

previous_headings: Introduction Step 1: Creating the Seurat object > Analysis of T-cell subset
title: Introduction to rmams
code: DefaultAssay(data.tcell) <- 'RNA' data.tcell <- NormalizeData(data.tcell) %>% FindVariableFeatures() %>% ScaleData() %>% RunPCA(reduction.name = "pca.tcell") data.tcell <- FindNeighbors(data.tcell, reduction = "pca.tcell", dims = 1:10) data.tcell <- FindClusters(data.tcell, resolution = 2, verbose = FALSE) data.tcell <- RunUMAP(data.tcell, reduction = 'pca.tcell', dims = 1:10, assay = 'RNA',                reduction.name = 'rna.tcell.umap', reduction.key = 'rnaTcellUMAP_') DimPlot(data.tcell, reduction = 'rna.tcell.umap')

previous_headings: Introduction Step 1: Creating the Seurat object > Analysis of T-cell subset
title: Introduction to rmams
code: DefaultAssay(data.tcell) <- 'ADT' VariableFeatures(data.tcell) <- rownames(data.tcell[["ADT"]]) data.tcell <- NormalizeData(data.tcell, normalization.method = 'CLR', margin = 2) %>%    ScaleData() %>% RunPCA(reduction.name = 'apca.tcell', dims = 1:10) data.tcell <- RunUMAP(data.tcell, reduction = 'apca.tcell', dims = 1:10, assay = 'ADT',                reduction.name = 'adt.tcell.umap', reduction.key = 'adtTcellUMAP_') data.tcell <- FindNeighbors(data.tcell, reduction = "apca.tcell", dims = 1:10) data.tcell <- FindClusters(data.tcell, graph.name = "ADT_snn", resolution = 2, verbose = FALSE) data.tcell <- FindClusters(data.tcell, algorithm = 3, resolution = 2, verbose = FALSE) DimPlot(data.tcell, reduction = 'adt.tcell.umap')

previous_headings: Introduction Step 1: Creating the Seurat object > Analysis of T-cell subset
title: Introduction to rmams
text: data matrices stored within Seurat object saved “rds” file. Note extract save matrix basic txt mtx file well.
code: data.tcell <- FindMultiModalNeighbors(   data.tcell, reduction.list = list("pca.tcell", "apca.tcell"),   dims.list = list(1:10, 1:10), modality.weight.name = "RNA.weight" ) data.tcell <- RunUMAP(data.tcell, nn.name = "weighted.nn", reduction.name = "wnn.tcell.umap", reduction.key = "wnnTcellUMAP_") data.tcell <- FindClusters(data.tcell, graph.name = "wsnn", algorithm = 3, resolution = 2, verbose = FALSE) DimPlot(data.tcell, reduction = 'wnn.tcell.umap', label = TRUE, repel = TRUE) saveRDS(data.raw, "../data/pbmc1k_seurat_raw.rds") saveRDS(data.nonempty, "../data/pbmc1k_seurat_nonempty.rds") saveRDS(data, "../data/pbmc1k_seurat_filtered.rds") saveRDS(data.tcell, "../data/pbmc1k_seurat_tcell.rds")

previous_headings: Introduction Step 1: Creating the Seurat object > Step 2 Creating the MAMS object from seurat object
title: Introduction to rmams
code: library(rmams)  file_paths <- c("../data/pbmc1k_seurat_filtered.rds", "../data/pbmc1k_seurat_nonempty.rds", "../data/pbmc1k_seurat_tcell.rds") file_names <-  gsub(pattern = "\\.rds$", replacement = "", x = basename(file_paths)) object_list <- lapply(file_paths, readRDS) names(object_list) <- file_names observational_subsets<-c("filtered","nonempty","subset") datasetid = "example"

previous_headings: Introduction Step 1: Creating the Seurat object > Step 2 Creating the MAMS object from seurat object
title: Introduction to rmams
code: result<- convert_seurat_to_MAMS(object_list,observational_subsets,datasetid)

previous_headings: Introduction Step 1: Creating the Seurat object > Step 2 Creating the MAMS object from seurat object
title: Introduction to rmams
code: # FOM object result@FOM[1] #> $fom1 #> An object of class "FOM" #> Slot "id": #> [1] "fom1" #>  #> Slot "dataset_id": #> [1] "example" #>  #> Slot "filepath": #> [1] "pbmc1k_seurat_filtered.rds" #>  #> Slot "accessor": #> [1] "GetAssayData(object = pbmc1k_seurat_filtered, slot = \"counts\" assay = \"ADT\")" #>  #> Slot "data_type": #> [1] "int" #>  #> Slot "representation": #> [1] NA #>  #> Slot "representation_description": #> [1] NA #>  #> Slot "obs_unit": #> [1] NA #>  #> Slot "processing": #> [1] "counts" #>  #> Slot "processing_description": #> [1] NA #>  #> Slot "analyte": #> [1] "protein" #>  #> Slot "analyte_description": #> [1] NA #>  #> Slot "modality": #> [1] "protein" #>  #> Slot "obs_subset": #> [1] NA #>  #> Slot "obs_subset_description": #> [1] NA #>  #> Slot "feature_subset": #> [1] NA #>  #> Slot "feature_subset_description": #> [1] NA #>  #> Slot "record_id": #> [1] NA #>  #> Slot "parent_id": #> [1] NA #>  #> Slot "parent_relationship": #> [1] NA #>  #> Slot "parent_relationship_description": #> [1] NA #>  #> Slot "oid": #> [1] "oid1" #>  #> Slot "fid": #> [1] NA #>  #> Slot "obs": #> [1] NA #>  #> Slot "fea": #> [1] NA #>  #> Slot "ong": #> [1] NA #>  #> Slot "fng": #> [1] NA

what: R Matrix and Analysis Metadata Standards
title: R Matrix and Analysis Metadata Standards
text: R package Matrix Analysis Metadata Standards Many molecular datasets generated across cancer types contain multi-modal data collected longitudinally- spatially-related biological specimens. major roadblock goal data stored wide variety file formats programming language-specific libraries, classes, data structures. Although wide range experimental protocols platforms available, important commonality across technologies often produce matrix features measured set observations. order facilitate data sharing across groups technologies, assays, promote interoperability -stream analysis tools, detailed data schema describing characteristics FOMs developed serve standard useful community.

title: R Matrix and Analysis Metadata Standards
code: install_github("single-cell-mams/rmams")

title: R Matrix and Analysis Metadata Standards
text: Matrix analysis metadata standards (MAMS) facilitate harmonization reproducibility single-cell data Yichen Wang, Irzam Sarfraz, Wei Kheng Teh, Artem Sokolov, Brian R. Herb, Heather H. Creasy, Isaac Virshup, Ruben Dries, Kylee Degatano, Anup Mahurkar, Daniel J Schnell, Pedro Madrigal, Jason Hilton, Nils Gehlenborg, Timothy Tickle, Joshua D. Campbell

title: Converts a Seurat object to a MAMS object. — convert_seurat_to_MAMS
text: object_list named list Seurat objects converted MAMS format observation_subsets vector length object_list indicating observation subset Seurat object. One : full, filtered, threshold, detected, nonartifact, clean.

code: create_FOM_object(   id = NA_character_,   dataset_id = NA_character_,   filepath = NA_character_,   accessor = NA_character_,   data_type = NA_character_,   representation = NA_character_,   representation_description = NA_character_,   obs_unit = NA_character_,   processing = NA_character_,   processing_description = NA_character_,   analyte = NA_character_,   analyte_description = NA_character_,   modality = NA_character_,   obs_subset = NA_character_,   obs_subset_description = NA_character_,   feature_subset = NA_character_,   feature_subset_description = NA_character_,   record_id = NA_character_,   parent_id = NA_character_,   parent_relationship = NA_character_,   parent_relationship_description = NA_character_,   oid = NA_character_,   fid = NA_character_,   obs = NA_character_,   fea = NA_character_,   ong = NA_character_,   fng = NA_character_ )

title: Constructor function to create a FOM object — create_FOM_object
text: id Denotes unique id matrix, annotation data frame, graph unique dataset_id ID dataset filepath Path file accessor Accessor data_type Explicitly describes type data stored FOM representation Preferred representation matrix representation_description detail representation obs_unit Biological unit observations processing Used describe nature data contained within matrix processing_description detail nature data analyte Used describe biological analytes quantified matrix analyte_description details analytes modality Describes modality matrix, may another field combination fields obs_subset Describes subset observations present FOM obs_subset_description subset observations feature_subset Describes subset features present FOM feature_subset_description subset features record_id Unique id denote combination entries record_package_name, record_package_version, record_function_name, record_function_parameters parent_id Denotes id(s) parent matrices used produce matrix parent_relationship Denotes type relationship parent matrix matrices parent_relationship_description type relationship parent matrix matrices oid Character vector combination character vectors used denote unique ID observation fid Character vector combination character vectors used denote unique ID feature obs Name matrices data frames number observations corresponding FOM fea Name matrices data frames number features corresponding FOM ong Name observation neighborhood graph fng Name feature neighborhood graph

title: Constructor function to create a FOM object — create_FOM_object
